required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retinal and Choroidal Circulation Changes Following Rapid Ascent to a High Altitude Environment
clinical_study.official_title: Retinal and Choroidal Circulation Changes Following Rapid Ascent to a High Altitude Environment Evaluated by OCT Angiography

lead_sponsor.agency: Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center, Sun Yat-sen University

clinical_study.source: Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center, Sun Yat-sen University

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective observational study. The purpose is to explore the effect of high altitude hypobaric hypoxia on retinal microcirculation and the change of the thickness of the retina and choroid by optical coherence tomography angiography (OCTA).

detailed_description.textblock: Yushu is in Qinghai-Tibet plateau, an average altitude of 4000 m. The medical staff is limited in Yushu. Zhongshan ophthalmic center, sun yat-sen university in Yushu blindness project has lasted many years. Some medical staff who arrived at Yushu will have a plateau response. The high altitude hypoxia on retinal microcirculation evaluated by OCTA has not been reported. The aim of the study is to observe the microcirculation changes after exploring a hypobaric and hypoxia environment using OCTA, and relation with the plateau response. OCTA is a non-invasive examination and could see the microcirculation of the fundus directly and quickly.

primary_outcome.description: the vascular density measured by OCTA

secondary_outcome.description: the retinal thickness measured by OCTA
the subfoveal choroidal thickness measured by OCTA

secondary_outcome.measure: The correlation of retinal microcirculation with the altitude illness
secondary_outcome.description: The relationship between retinal vascular density as measured by OCTA and the degree of altitude illness as measured by acute mountain sickness (AMS) scoring system
The changes of intraocular pressure measured by icare Tonometer

secondary_outcome.measure: The changes of blood pressure including systolic and diastolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.description: The changes of blood pressure measured by Blood Pressure Meter
The changes of blood Oxygen measured by Pulse Oximeter
the degree of altitude illness was assessed by acute mountain sickness (AMS) scoring system

arm_group.description: This is a self-control study. Subjects who plan togo to 4000m altitude to work for two weeks will be enrolled. And before and after they arrive high altitude, they will have visual acuity, OCTA, and intraocular pressure; blood pressure, blood oxygen measurement.

intervention.description: The participants will go to 4000m altitude to work for two weeks.

study_pop.textblock: the staff will go to Yushu on the 2020 preventive blindness project.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. The subjects who plan to go to Yushu within one month.
2. Did not live on the high altitude of more than 1000 meters within 6 months.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Unable and unwilling to provide informed consent.
2. Any ocular disease may influence the retinal and choroidal circulation.

overall_official.affiliation: Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center, Sun Yat-sen University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center, Sun Yat-sen University

patient_data.ipd_description: After the result publish online, the data will be shared.
